translations.text: Most blessed is He<sup foot_note="179602">1</sup> Who sent down this Criterion<sup foot_note="179603">2</sup><sup foot_note="179604">3</sup> on His servant, to be a warner to all mankind;<sup foot_note="179605">4</sup>

He to Whom belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth;<sup foot_note="179606">1</sup> Who has taken to Himself no son<sup foot_note="179607">2</sup> nor has He taken any partner in His kingdom;<sup foot_note="179608">3</sup> Who created everything and then determined its destiny.<sup foot_note="179609">4</sup>

Yet people have taken, instead of Him, other deities; those that create nothing but are themselves created;<sup foot_note="179610">1</sup> who do not have the power to hurt or benefit even themselves; who have no power over death, nor over life, nor over the resurrection of the dead.<sup foot_note="179611">2</sup>

Those who disbelieve in the Message of the Prophet say: "This (Criterion) is nothing but a lie which he has forged with the help of others." Such have indeed resorted to a grievous wrong and sheer falsehood.<sup foot_note="179612">1</sup>
They say: "These are merely fairy tales of the ancients which he has got inscribed and they are then recited to him morning and evening."

Say to them (O Muhammad): "It is He Who knows the secrets of the heavens and the earth<sup foot_note="179613">1</sup> Who has sent down this Book. Indeed, He is Most Forgiving, Most Compassionate."<sup foot_note="179614">2</sup>

They say: "What sort of a Messenger is this: he eats food and walks about in the markets?<sup foot_note="179558">1</sup> Why was an angel not sent down to him so that he may remain with the Messenger and warn those that do not believe in him?<sup foot_note="179559">2</sup>

Why was a treasure not bestowed upon him, or a garden whereof he might obtain his sustenance?"<sup foot_note="179616">1</sup> The evil-doers say: "You are simply following a bewitched man."<sup foot_note="179617">2</sup>
See what specious arguments they put forth before you: they are so strayed that they will not find their way to anything sound.<sup foot_note="179618">1</sup>
Most blessed<sup foot_note="179619">1</sup> is He Who, if He wills, can grant you even better than what they propose: Gardens beneath which rivers flow, and stately mansions.
Nay, the truth is that it is the Hour<sup foot_note="179620">1</sup>  to which they give the lie.<sup foot_note="179621">2</sup>; We have kept a Blazing Fire ready for him who denies the Hour.
When it sees<sup foot_note="179622">1</sup> them from a place afar, they will hear its raging and roaring,
and when they are flung, chained together, into a narrow place in it, they will fervently call there for annihilation.
(They will then be told): "Do not call for a single annihilation, but for many an annihilation."
Ask them: "Is this state better or the Garden of Eternity which the God-fearing have been promised?" It shall be their recompense and the end-point of their journey;
the Garden wherein whatever they desire will be fulfilled. In it they shall abide for ever. This is a promise whose fulfilment Your Lord has made incumbent on Himself.<sup foot_note="179623">1</sup>

On the Day when He will muster together all the unbelievers as well as the deities that they worship beside Allah,<sup foot_note="179624">1</sup> and He will ask them: "Was it you who caused these servants of Mine to stray away, or did they themselves stray away from the Right Path?"<sup foot_note="179625">2</sup>

They will say: "Glory be to You! It did not behove us to take any other than You as our guardians, but You lavished the pleasures of life upon them and their forefathers until they forgot the Admonition and became doomed to destruction."<sup foot_note="179626">1</sup>

Thus will those deities give the lie to all what you now say,<sup foot_note="179627">1</sup> and you will not be able to avert your doom, nor obtain any succour. We shall cause whoever of you commits wrong<sup foot_note="179628">2</sup> to taste an enormous chastisement.

(O Muhammad), We never sent any Messengers before you but they ate food and walked about in the markets.<sup foot_note="179629">1</sup> We made some of you a means to test each by the other<sup foot_note="179630">2</sup> to see whether you remain patient.<sup foot_note="179631">3</sup> Your Lord is All-Seeing.<sup foot_note="179632">4</sup>

Those who do not look forward to meet Us say:<sup foot_note="179633">1</sup> "Why should angels not be sent to us, or why do we ourselves not observe our Lord?"<sup foot_note="179634">2</sup> Surely they are too proud of themselves<sup foot_note="179635">3</sup> and have gone beyond all limits in their rebellion.
On that Day - the Day when they will behold angels - there will be no good news for those immersed in evil,<sup foot_note="179636">1</sup> and they will cry out: "We seek refuge (in Allah)."
And We shall turn to their deeds and shall reduce them to scattered dust.<sup foot_note="179637">1</sup>
On that Day it is the inmates of Paradise that will be graced with a better abode and a fairer resting place.<sup foot_note="179638">1</sup>
On that Day the sky shall be rent asunder by a cloud and a whole cavalcade of angels will be made to descend.
On that Day the true kingdom will belong only to the Merciful Lord.<sup foot_note="179639">1</sup> That will be a hard day for those that deny the Truth;
a Day when the wrong-doer will bite his hands, saying: "Would that I had stood by the Messenger!
Woe is me! Would that I had not taken such a one for a friend!
He led me astray from the Admonition that had come to me. Satan proved to be a great betrayer of man."<sup foot_note="179640">1</sup>
And the Messenger will say: "My Lord! My own people had made this Qur'an an object of laughter."<sup foot_note="179641">1</sup>

(O Muhammad), thus did We make for every Prophet enemies<sup foot_note="179642">1</sup> from among those immersed in evil. Your Lord suffices you as a Guide and a Helper.<sup foot_note="179643">2</sup>

Those who disbelieve say: "Why was the Qur'an not revealed to him all at once?"<sup foot_note="179644">1</sup> It was revealed thus that We may fully impress it on your mind;<sup foot_note="179645">2</sup> (and for the same end) We have revealed it gradually (according to a scheme) in fragments.
(This was also done so that) whenever they put any strange question to you, We sent its right answer and explained the matter in the best manner.<sup foot_note="179615">1</sup>
Those who shall be mustered in the Hell upon their faces, their stand is the worst and their way most erroneous.<sup foot_note="179646">1</sup>
Verily We granted Moses the Book<sup foot_note="179647">1</sup> and appointed his brother Aaron with him as his helper
and said to him: "Go the two of you to the people who have given the lie to Our Signs."<sup foot_note="179648">1</sup> Thereafter We utterly destroyed them.

(The same happened with) the people of Noah: when they gave the lie to the Messengers<sup foot_note="179649">1</sup> We drowned them and made of them a Sign of warning for all mankind. We have kept ready a painful chastisement for the wrong-doers<sup foot_note="179650">2</sup>.
And in like manner were the 'Ad and the Thamud destroyed and the people of al-Rass<sup foot_note="179651">1</sup> and many a nation in the centuries in between.
We warned each (of them) by examples (of the nations so destroyed in the past), and We totally annihilated each of them.

They have surely passed by the town which was rained upon by an evil rain.<sup foot_note="179652">1</sup> Have they not seen it? Nay; but they do not believe in being raised up after death.<sup foot_note="179653">2</sup>
Whenever they see you they take you for nothing else but an object of jest, saying: "Is this whom Allah has sent as a Messenger?

Had we not firmly persevered in our devotion to them<sup foot_note="179654">1</sup> (he had almost) led us astray from our gods." But soon, when they see the chastisement, they will come to know who had strayed too far from the Right Way.
Have you ever considered the case of him who has taken his carnal desire for his god?<sup foot_note="179655">1</sup> Can you take responsibility for guiding him to the Right Way?
Do you think that most of them hear or understand? For they are merely like cattle; nay, even worse than them.<sup foot_note="179656">1</sup>
Have you not seen how your Lord spreads the shade? If He will, He could have made it stationary; instead, We have made the sun its pilot.<sup foot_note="179657">1</sup>
So (as the sun rises), We gradually roll up that shade unto Us.<sup foot_note="179658">1</sup>
It is Allah Who has made night a garment for you,<sup foot_note="179659">1</sup> and sleep the repose (of death), and has made day the time of rising to life.<sup foot_note="179660">2</sup>
And He it is Who sends forth the winds as glad tidings, heralding His Mercy. Then We send down pure water<sup foot_note="179661">1</sup> from the sky
that We may revive through it a dead land and give it for drink to many cattle and human beings from among Our creation.<sup foot_note="179662">1</sup>

We present this wondrous phenomenon to them over and over again<sup foot_note="179663">1</sup> that they may learn a lesson from it. But most people simply decline everything except disbelief and ingratitude.<sup foot_note="179664">2</sup>
Had We so willed, We would have raised up in every town a warner.<sup foot_note="179665">1</sup>
So, (O Prophet), do not follow the unbelievers but engage in a mighty striving against them with this Qur'an.

And He it is Who has joined the two seas: one sweet and palatable and the other saltish and bitter; and He has set a barrier and an insurmountable obstruction between the two that keeps them apart.<sup foot_note="179666">1</sup>
And He it is Who has created man from water and then produced from him two sorts of kindred: by descent and by marriage. Your Lord is All-Powerful.<sup foot_note="179667">1</sup>

And yet people worship deities other than Allah that can neither benefit them nor hurt them. Besides, the unbeliever is ever prone to come to the support of everyone who rebels against his Lord.<sup foot_note="179668">1</sup>
We have not sent you, (O Muhammad), except as a bearer of good tidings and a warner.<sup foot_note="179669">1</sup>
Say to them: "I ask of you no reward for my work. My only reward is that whoever so wills may follow the way leading to His Lord."71a
(O Muhammad), put your trust in Him Who is Ever-Living, Who will never die, and glorify Him with His praise. He suffices as the Knower of the sins of His servants,

He Who created the heavens and the earth and all that is in between them in six days, and then ascended the Throne;<sup foot_note="179670">1</sup> the Merciful One. Ask concerning Him the one who knows.

When they are told: "Prostrate yourselves before the Merciful One," they say: "What is the Merciful One? Shall we prostrate ourselves before whomsoever you command us to prostrate?"<sup foot_note="179671">1</sup> This even further increases their aversion.<sup foot_note="179672">2</sup>
Most blessed is He Who set a constellation in the heavens,<sup foot_note="179673">1</sup> and placed in it a great lamp<sup foot_note="179674">2</sup> and a shining moon.
He it is Who has appointed night and day to succeed one another (as a Sign) for him who desires to take heed, or desires to be thankful.<sup foot_note="179675">1</sup>

The true servants of the Merciful One are those<sup foot_note="179676">1</sup> who walk on the earth gently<sup foot_note="179677">2</sup> and when the foolish ones address them, they simply say: "Peace to you";<sup foot_note="179678">3</sup>
who spend the night prostrating themselves before their Lord and standing;<sup foot_note="179679">1</sup>
who entreat: "Our Lord! Ward off from us the chastisement of Hell, for its chastisement is one that clings.
Verily it is a wretched abode and restingplace."<sup foot_note="179680">1</sup>
(The true servants of the Merciful One are) those who are neither extravagant nor niggardly in their spending but keep the golden mean between the two;<sup foot_note="179681">1</sup>

who invoke no other deity along with Allah, nor take any life - which Allah has forbidden - save justly; who do not commit unlawful sexual intercourse<sup foot_note="179682">1</sup> - and whoso does that shall meet its penalty;
his torment shall be doubled for him on the Day of Resurrection,<sup foot_note="179683">1</sup> and he will abide in it in ignominy -
unless he repents and believes and does righteous works. For such, Allah will change their evil deeds into good deeds.<sup foot_note="179684">1</sup> Allah is Ever Forgiving, Most Compassionate.
Whosoever repents<sup foot_note="179685">1</sup> and does good, he returns to Allah in the manner that he should.<sup foot_note="179686">2</sup>

(The true servants of the Merciful One) are those who do not bear witness to any falsehood<sup foot_note="179687">1</sup> and who, when they pass by frivolity, pass by it with dignity;<sup foot_note="179688">2</sup>
who, when they are reminded of the revelations of their Lord,<sup foot_note="179689">1</sup> do not fall at them deaf and blind;

who are prone to pray: "Our Lord! Grant us that our spouses and our offspring be a joy to our eyes,<sup foot_note="179690">1</sup> and do make us the leaders of the God-fearing."<sup foot_note="179691">2</sup>

They are the ones who will be rewarded for their patience: lofty palaces<sup foot_note="179692">1</sup> <sup foot_note="179693">2</sup> will be granted to them, and they will be received with greeting and salutation.
Therein they shall abide for ever: how good an abode, and how good a resting-place!

Say to them (O Muhammad): "My Lord would not care for you were it not for your prayer<sup foot_note="179694">1</sup>. But now that you have given the lie to (the Message of Allah), an inextricable punishment shall soon come upon you."
